title: The Ultimate 5-Category Mix
description: Test yourself across History, Science, Geography, Pop Culture, and Video Games.

items.q: Who discovered America in 1492?
items.explanation: He thought he had reached the East Indies.

items.q: What ancient civilization built the Machu Picchu?
items.explanation: Located in the Andes mountains of Peru.

items.q: Julius Caesar was assassinated on the Ides of March.
items.explanation: He was stabbed to death at a meeting of the Senate.

items.q: Who was the first female Prime Minister of the UK?
items.explanation: She was known as the 'Iron Lady'.

items.q: Who was the British Prime Minister during most of World War II?
items.explanation: Known for his inspiring speeches during the Blitz.

items.q: In what year did World War II end?
items.explanation: The war ended with the surrender of Japan in September 1945.

items.q: Who was the first President of the United States?
items.explanation: He served two terms from 1789 to 1797.

items.q: The Great Wall of China is visible from the Moon with the naked eye.
items.explanation: It is a myth that the Great Wall is visible from the Moon without aid.

items.q: Who painted the Mona Lisa?
items.explanation: The painting is currently housed in the Louvre in Paris.

items.q: In what year did the Titanic sink?
items.explanation: It struck an iceberg during its maiden voyage.

items.q: What is the powerhouse of the cell?
items.explanation: They generate most of the chemical energy needed to power the cell's biochemical reactions.

items.q: What gas do plants absorb from the atmosphere?
items.explanation: They use it along with sunlight and water to produce their own food.

items.q: What is the hardest natural substance on Earth?
items.explanation: Diamonds are formed from pure carbon under intense heat and pressure.

items.q: What organ is responsible for pumping blood throughout the body?
items.explanation: It is a muscular organ located perfectly in the center of your chest.

items.q: What is the chemical symbol for Gold?
items.explanation: The symbol comes from 'aurum', the Latin word for gold.

items.q: What force keeps planets in orbit around the sun?
items.explanation: Described by Isaac Newton and later expanded by Albert Einstein.

items.q: Venus is the hottest planet in our solar system.
items.explanation: Its thick atmosphere traps heat, leading to extreme greenhouse effects.

items.q: What is the largest planet in our solar system?
items.explanation: It is a gas giant with dozens of moons.

items.q: Water consists of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom.
items.explanation: The chemical formula for water is widely known as H2O.

items.q: What scientist proposed the theory of relativity?
items.explanation: His equation E=mc^2 is the most famous in physics.

items.q: What is the smallest country in the world by land area?
items.explanation: It is an independent city-state enclaved within Rome, Italy.

items.q: What is the capital of Australia?
items.explanation: It was chosen as the capital in 1908 as a compromise between Sydney and Melbourne.

items.q: What is the capital city of Japan?
items.explanation: It is one of the most populous metropolitan areas in the world.

items.q: Which continent is the Sahara Desert located on?
items.explanation: It covers most of North Africa and is roughly the size of the United States.

items.q: What is the longest river in the world?
items.explanation: Though the Amazon is highly debated to be essentially tied.

items.q: In which US state would you find the Grand Canyon?
items.explanation: It was carved by the Colorado River.

items.q: What ocean lies off the east coast of the United States?
items.explanation: It separates the Americas from Europe and Africa.

items.q: Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world.
items.explanation: It is located in the Himalayas on the border between Nepal and China.

items.q: There is no landmass at the North Pole.
items.explanation: Unlike the South Pole, which is on the continent of Antarctica, the North Pole is just ice over ocean.

items.q: What country has the largest population in the world?
items.explanation: India recently surpassed China as the most populous country.

items.q: Who played the character of Iron Man in the Marvel Cinematic Universe?
items.explanation: He kicked off the MCU with the first Iron Man film in 2008.

items.q: Which boy band included members Harry Styles, Liam Payne, Louis Tomlinson, Niall Horan, and Zayn Malik?
items.explanation: Formed on the British television show The X Factor in 2010.

items.q: The Beatles formed in Liverpool, England.
items.explanation: They became the most influential band of all time out of Liverpool.

items.q: Which pop star's fan base is known as the 'Swifties'?
items.explanation: She famously began re-recording her albums as 'Taylor's Version'.

items.q: Who directed the blockbuster film Avatar?
items.explanation: He also directed Titanic and Terminator 2.

items.q: What famous coffee shop is prominently featured in the sitcom 'Friends'?
items.explanation: Gunther was the famously exasperated manager of the shop.

items.q: Michael Jackson is known as the 'King of Pop'.
items.explanation: He popularized the moonwalk and broke numerous records with Thriller.

items.q: Which movie won the Academy Award for Best Picture in 1998?
items.explanation: It won 11 Oscars in total, tying the record held by Ben-Hur.

items.q: What TV series featured dragons, White Walkers, and the Iron Throne?
items.explanation: Based on George R.R. Martin's 'A Song of Ice and Fire'.

items.q: What magical sport is played on flying broomsticks in Harry Potter?
items.explanation: Players score by throwing a Quaffle through hoops or catching the Golden Snitch.

items.q: What fighting game features characters like Ryu, Ken, and Chun-Li?
items.explanation: The release of Street Fighter II in 1991 revolutionized the fighting game genre.

items.q: What is the highest-selling video game console of all time?
items.explanation: It sold over 155 million units worldwide.

items.q: Minecraft was created by a single person originally.
items.explanation: It was created by Markus 'Notch' Persson before his company Mojang was acquired by Microsoft.

items.q: What block-building game is the best-selling game of all time?
items.explanation: It has sold over 300 million copies across all platforms.

items.q: What is the primary currency in the Fallout series?
items.explanation: They were adopted because they are hard to counterfeit and limited in number.

items.q: Mario first appeared in the arcade game Donkey Kong.
items.explanation: In that game, his name was Jumpman.

items.q: What arcade game involves eating dots and running from ghosts?
items.explanation: The ghosts are named Blinky, Pinky, Inky, and Clyde.

items.q: Who is the main antagonist of the Portal series?
items.explanation: Genetic Lifeform and Disk Operating System is a rogue AI that loves deadly tests.

items.q: What is the name of the protagonist in the Legend of Zelda series?
items.explanation: Despite the title, the player almost always controls Link, not Zelda.

items.q: What company created the Pokémon franchise?
items.explanation: The franchise encompasses video games, trading cards, and television.
